note.p: Career: Went to Holland and accompanied a corps of French Protestant refugees to Spain, where he was taken prisoner at the Battle of Almanza (1707); escaped being burnt alive as a heretic on the intervention of the Duke of Berwick; sent to Montpellier, he escaped to Geneva and then to Holland; Pastor at Rotterdam; went to London (1711); Pastor of the French Church, St Martin's Lane and later of the French Church in the Savoy
Notes: Proposed by John Gaspar Scheuchzer; Sir Hans Sloane; Peter Desmaizeaux
